(&) on page 3 must also be included. In addition, a number of vessels shown under ore, phosphates, lead, &c, load ouuyarn foAn Allied Government. A comparison of the numbers shown under IV. for the 8 months does net therefore give an accurate criterion of tfl vessels in Allied service at the difierent periods.II Includi-ig 12 vessels formerly shown under separate heading " Trading for Colonies." *S "Requisition" is here used to mean "requisition for full Government service." The vessels shown as "free from requisition" therefor include the vessels that are requisitioned under the special liner requisitioning scheme, under which vessels, while running for Government account are run by their owners and accept some private cargo (see page 4). ,.ft Includes 27 vessels (67,363 G.T.) transferred from Norwegian nag under the Norwegian Agreement. As these require to be replaceu i Njrwegian service bv British vessels they do not represent additional vessels available for British service. 1,600 gross tonnage and over on 1918.Lakes) as to render them not available for ocean-going trade or requisition.II.ANALYSIS OF VESSELS UNDER NOTICE OP REQUISITION, SHOWN UNDER II.
